title: Colts unite to conquer powerhouse Reds in BASL women final | Bendigo Advertiser
body_text:
STRATHFIELDSAYE Colts United put three earlier losses this year against Spring Gully United behind it to capture BASL's League 1 Women's Super Cup title on Sunday.
Subscribe now for unlimited access.
or signup to continue reading
Spring Gully United was aiming to complete the Bendigo Amateur Soccer League's championship-Super Cup double, but was thwarted by Colts, who won the grand final 3-2 at Beischer Park.
The two teams had met three times this season with the previously undefeated Reds winning all three encounters: 4-2 and 6-1 in the championship season and 6-3 in the semi-finals of the League Cup.
However, it was Colts that shrugged off their underdog tag to end their 2025 season with some new silverware to add to their trophy cabinet.
"That was incredible; the girls really dug deep today in what was a tough game," an elated Strathfieldsaye Colts United coach Rebecca Berry said.
"We prepared really well for today and were in the right mindset of really wanting it, so it's great we've been able to do it.
"Spring Gully had beaten us three times this year and we knew today was going to be really hard, but we felt like we had what it takes and I'm really proud."
Captain Maddie Ridsdale opened the scoring for Colts in the 18th minute with the first of her two goals, while Berry also slotted a goal for the winners.
Spring Gully United's two goals were kicked by Skye Barker and competition leading goalscorer Madeline White.
Sunday was only the second loss Spring Gully United has suffered across its 32 games in the championship-Super Cup over the past two years.
LEAGUE 1 MEN'S RESERVES
* The League 1 Men's Reserves match between Eaglehawk and Shepparton was halted before full-time when Shepparton walked off the field.
The Hawks were leading 1-0 when Shepparton walked off after what had been a fiery game in which there were four red cards issued to Shepparton players.
The Bendigo Advertiser contacted Shepparton on Tuesday regarding the walk off, but the club declined to comment.
While the game didn't go the full distance, enough time had elapsed for the result to stand and the Hawks be declared the winners.
"We're proud of what of our boys have been able to achieve this year to be both champions and winners of the Super Cup is a great achievement," Eaglehawk president Brent Hamblin said.
BASL president Aaron Shooter said an investigation was likely to be held in response to the match, which ended late in the second half and had required security to intervene.
Because of the likely investigation into the match, Hamblin chose not to comment on the Shepparton walk-off.
"Firstly, whatever the referee issued on the day (in terms of red cards), the normal outcomes of those will be applied and anything over and above that will be investigated," Shooter said.
"Football Victoria has taken over grievance and tribunal from BASL this year, so they will follow through their process and the outcomes of those investigations will determine whatever the punishments may be.
"It was generally a great day of soccer on Sunday across all competitions, but this just takes away from the day.
"We've got tremendous growth happening in the game, but this detracts from it and is definitely not the look we want for the game."
LEAGUE 1 MEN
* Shepparton United added the League 1 Men's Super Cup title to its League Cup trophy from earlier in the year.
Shepparton United defeated Shepparton South 2-1 after making its move in the first half.
United led 2-0 at half-time following goals to Hassan Alhilfi (28th minute) and Riki Koyanagl (35th) in what proved to be a match-winning seven-minute burst.
Shepparton South closed back within one goal after Jaxan McDonald found the back of the net in the second half in the 66th minute, but United was able to defend its 2-1 lead to win.
Although beaten on Sunday, Shepparton South claimed the championship having topped the ladder after the 14 home and away rounds.
LEAGUE 2 MEN
* Spring Gully United put the icing on the cake to its League 2 Men's season with a win over Golden City.
The Reds won 2-0 with Noah Kelly kicking both goals in the first half in the 10th and 41st minute to cap a season in which the club completed the championship-Super Cup double.
LEAGUE 2 WOMEN
* Castlemaine Goldfields Green produced a dominant performance in the League 2 Women's grand final, defeating Kyneton District Maroon by five goals.
After leading 2-0 at half-time Castlemaine Goldfields banged home four more goals after the break to win 6-1.
Lily Pridham kicked two goals for Castlemaine Goldfields, while Molly Kilgour McCarthy, Carolina Joaquim, Sophie Milton and Brooke Bennett all slotted one.
LEAGUE 2 MEN'S RESERVES
* As well as winning the League Men's 1 Reserves, Eaglehawk was also victorious in the League 2 Men's Reserves contest after winning on penalties against La Trobe University, with scores having been initially tied 1-1 at full-time.
A late goal from La Trobe Uni's Lachlan Hogan to level scores sent the game into penalties, which the Hawks won 3-0.
Grand final weekend for the BASL also included 13 junior matches played.
Junior grand final results:
U12A - Spring Gully Vipers 1 def Kyneton District 0.
12A Girls - Strathfieldsaye Colts United Black 1 def Kyneton District Maroon 0.
U12B - Kyneton District Blue 3 def Strathdale Wanderers 0.
U12B Girls - Strathdale Angel Sharks 4 def Spring Gully Red Foxes 1.
U12C - Border Raiders Vikings 6 def Spring Gully Devils 0.
U12D - Border Raiders Pirates 6 def Strathfieldsaye Colts United White 0.
U14A - Strathdale City 1 def Spring Gully Rangers 0.
U14B - Golden City Merinos 5 def Kyneton Maroon 1.
U14C - Swan Hill 4 def Spring Gully Jets 1.
U14 Girls - Strathdale 1 def Kyneton District Maroon 0.
U16A - Kyneton District 2 def Spring Gully Red 1.
U16B - Swan Hill 2 def Epsom Scorpions 2.
U16 Girls - Epsom Stars 5 def Daylesford & Hepburn United 2.
